rtega_mnemonic:
羨羨RS羡envy, admire, praise, covet
  • man's mouth drooping with saliva 㳄 because he envies a beautiful sheep ⺷
purpleculture_info: Pictophonetic: 㳄 indicates the sound; 羊 (sheep) conveys the meaning.

heisig_chinese_memo: A very thirsty sheep, who always lacked water, spends his days watching his fellow sheep (in the farm next door or in another pen) and being very envyous of their water.
heisig_constituent: envious, sheep, water, water droplets, water pistol, lack, yawn
heisig_story: Sheep . . . water . . . yawn/lack. Although this character looks rather simple, special care should be taken in learning it because of the proximity of the final two elements to the character for next, which we learned in frame 510. Note, too, that the water comes UNDER the sheep, rather than on its own to the left.
koohiiStory1: A very thirsty sheep, who always lacked water, spends his days watching his fellow sheep (in the farm next door or in another pen) and being very envious of their water.
koohiiStory2: Envious of the greener grass on the other side of the fence, the sheep looks down in disgust at his own dry grass lacking water.
jp_example_words:
羨ましい(うらやましい): envious, enviable
羨む(うらやむ): envy
jp_readingExamples: 羨ましい (うらや.ましい), 羨む (うらや.む)
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: Horns grow on the king that will be next because they're full of envy and jealousy for the present king.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Picture the person next up for king. They have to sit in a chair behind the current king, and as they glare in front of them with envy, horns start to sprout out of their head.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: If they can't control their envy and jealousy, they'll start growing hooves and extra legs, until one day, they turn entirely into a centaur (せん)! A jealous centaur, who will never be king.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Centaurs can't be the next king, so people really need to be careful about how much they let jealousy consume them. If you don't watch out, you'll turn into something ugly and twisted.
Ru_Radicals: 并, 汁 (суп), 欠 (недостача), 王 (монарх), 羊 (овца)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: if there's a lack of water (㳄) the sheep (𦍌) will be envious
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: The next sheep in line to be head of herd always envies (envy) the current leader.
humanum_full_description_en:
Xiaozhuan " Xian " from " yang " from "㳄", oracle bone inscription "㳄" looks like a person's mouth drooling, extended to envy, and inscriptions are overflowing; Lin Yiguang said that the word " Xian " looks like a sheep and salivates Next, Gu Bei said. Self-coveting leads to the meaning of greed and envy. Today, when someone is greedy for something, it is still called coveting, and it is also called envy.

" Xian " is a variant of "㵪", see the ancient script of Khan Jian, the following "㳄" is from Ershui, made " 𣶙 ", which is the same as "㳄"'s "Said Wen".

"㳄", " envy ", " amber ", " shameful " sound and meaning are close to all of this, "㳄" bones a shape, it is often common. Xuanying "All Sutras' Sounds and Meanings": "㵪, also made salivation. "Zi Lin": "Musy to say 㵪." "Jade Chapter.㳄部": "㳄, also for salivation." "Erya. "Explanation" "Luan, Shu Ye", Guo's Note: "Liao Luo out of 唌mo." "Classic Interpretation": "唌, the word is used as 㳄, and also as salivation." Jia Yi, "New Book": "We are envious." , That is, "covet to tell each other."

Therefore, " envy " has the meaning of envy and excess. "poetry. Xiaoya: "Envy in the Four Directions", Mao Heng Chuan: "Xian, Yu Ye." "Historical Records. "The Legend of Sima Xiangru": "Gong envy to the Five Emperors." "Suo Yin" Sima Biaoyun: "Envy, overflow." " Xian " means water overflow, and it is also known as " yan ", "Han Shu. "Gou Xia Zhi": "However, the envy of the river disaster is overflowing, and it is especially harmful to China." Yan Shi's ancient note: "Envy reading and Yantong." "Historical Records. "Hequshu" is written as "The River Can Yan overflowing." See " Yan ".

"Said Wen": "Envy, greed and desire. From 㳄, from the province of Lei. Lei calls for the Lei, the king of Wen constrains Lei." Lin Yiguang said that the word from the sheep from 㳄, like seeing the beauty of the sheep and salivating, lonely prepare One said. Press " Sheep " as the suffix , and the original meaning should be the same as "㳄". See also "㳄", " saliva ", "唌".

See " Mu ".
humanum_short_description_en: Xiaozhuan from " sheep " from "㳄", oracle bone inscription "㳄" looks like a person's mouth drooling, and " Xian " is like seeing a sheep beautiful and salivating (Lin Yiguang).
humanum_full_description:
小篆「羨」字從「羊」從「㳄」，甲骨文「㳄」象人張口流口水形，引伸為羨溢，卜辭表示泛濫；林義光謂「羨」字象見羊美而涎欲下，孤備一說。自垂涎引伸出貪羨之義，今天說一人貪求某物仍曰垂涎，亦曰羨慕，即本於此。

　　「羨」異體作「㵪」，參見汗簡古文，下面之「㳄」從二水，作「𣶙」，與「㳄」的《說文》籀文形同。

　　「㳄」、「羨」、「涎」、「唌」音義都近，皆本於「㳄」甲骨一形，故常常通用。玄應《一切經音義》：「㵪，又作涎。《字林》：『慕欲曰㵪。』」《玉篇．㳄部》：「㳄，亦作涎。」《爾雅．釋言》「漦，盝也」，郭注：「漉漉出唌沫。」《經典釋文》：「唌，字當作㳄，又作涎。」賈誼《新書》：「垂羨相告」，即「垂涎相告」。

　　故「羨」有羨溢、多餘之義。《詩．小雅》：「四方有羨」，毛亨傳：「羨，餘也。」《史記．司馬相如傳》：「功羨於五帝。」《索隱》司馬彪云：「羨，溢也。」「羨」表示水溢，又通作「衍」，《漢書．溝洫志》：「然河災之羨溢，害中國也尤甚。」顏師古注：「羨讀與衍同。」《史記．河渠書》作「河菑衍溢。」參見「衍」。

　　《說文》：「羨，貪欲也。从㳄，从羑省。羑呼之羑，文王所拘羑里。」林義光謂字從羊從㳄，象見羊美而涎欲下，孤備一說。按「羊」為後加，本義當與「㳄」同。參見「㳄」、「涎」、「唌」。

　　參見「慕」。
humanum_short_description: 小篆從「羊」從「㳄」，甲骨文「㳄」象人張口流口水形，「羨」象見羊美而涎欲下（林義光）。

羨字的基本解释

羨
xiàn
同“羡”。

羨字的汉语字典释义

[①]［xiàn］
［《廣韻》似面切，去線，邪。］
亦作“羡1”。
(1)因喜爱而希望得到；羡慕。
(2)有馀；剩馀。
(3)超过。
(4)满；丰裕。
(5)丧失。
(6)邪，不正。
(7)长。
(8)指璧的边缘。
(9)姓。《史记·秦始皇本纪》有羡門。
[②]［yán］
［《廣韻》予線切，去線，以。］
［《集韻》夷然切，平，以。］
(1)通“延”。邀请。
(2)通“埏”。墓道。

羨字的康熙字典解释

【未集中】【羊字部】　羨； 康熙笔画：13； 页码：页952第31
【廣韻】【集韻】【正韻】?似面切，音䢭。【說文】貪欲也。从㳄，从羑省。【詩·大雅】無然歆羨。【註】無是貪羨。　又【廣韻】餘也。【詩·小雅】四方有羨。【傳】羨，餘也。【箋】四方之人，盡有饒餘。【史記·貨殖傳】時有奇羨。【註】奇羨，謂時有餘衍也。　又【周禮·春官·典瑞】壁羨以起度。【註】鄭司農云：羨，長也。　又【史記·司馬相如傳】功羨於五帝。【註】羨，溢也。　又【廣韻】人姓。【史記·秦始皇紀】入海求羨門高誓。【註】羨門，古仙人。　又【集韻】【類篇】【韻會】?延面切，音衍。【韻會】以淺切，音演。義?同。　又【集韻】夷然切，音延。埏或作羨。墓道也。【史記·衞世家】共伯入，釐侯羨自殺。【註】索隱日，羨音延，墓道。　【集韻】俗作㵪，非是。

小篆楷体

暂无。

envy
Name meaning

xiàn
вм. 羡
Radicals: 王, 次  (king, next, horns)
Meaning Mnemonic
Horns grow on the king that will be next because they're full of envy and jealousy for the present king.
Picture the person next up for king. They have to sit in a chair behind the current king, and as they glare in front of them with envy, horns start to sprout out of their head.
Reading Mnemonic
If they can't control their envy and jealousy, they'll start growing hooves and extra legs, until one day, they turn entirely into a centaur (せん)! A jealous centaur, who will never be king.
Centaurs can't be the next king, so people really need to be careful about how much they let jealousy consume them. If you don't watch out, you'll turn into something ugly and twisted.
